required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess Demographic, Pharmacologic, Biomarker, Clinical Features and Quality of Life (QoL) of Participants With Lupus Nephritis
clinical_study.official_title: LUNELORD: A Descriptive, Prospective Study to Assess Demographic, Pharmacologic, Biomarker, Clinical Features and QoL of Patients With LUpus NEphritis and Long-term ORgan Damage

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter prospective study to assess clinical characteristics, demographics, treatment and health-related quality of life (HRQoL) of lupus nephritis (LN) participants across 5 Gulf countries (United Arab Emirates [UAE], Qatar, Bahrain, Kuwait and Oman).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with demographic characteristics
Number of participants with clinical manifestations of Lupus Nephritis
Severity of Lupus Nephritis in participants
Number of participants with treatments for lupus nephritis
36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) total score
primary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item QoL questionnaire covering 8 health domains. Scores for each domain range from 0 to 100, with a higher score defining a more favorable health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with refractory Lupus Nephritis
Change from Baseline in anti-nuclear antibody
Change from Baseline in antibody to double-stranded deoxyribonucleic acid test (anti-dsDNA antibody)
Change from Baseline in complement (C3 and C4) levels
Number of participants with renal remission
Changes in the SF-36 physical and mental components score and the total scores at one year (Scores on a scale)
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item QoL questionnaire covering 8 health domains. Scores for each domain range from 0 to 100, with a higher score defining a more favorable health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with healthcare resource utilization (HCRU)
Direct medical costs associated with lupus nephritis management
Number of participants with difference in treatment patterns

intervention.description: Participants will be required to complete the participant survey.
Data will be collected from medical charts of participants.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with lupus nephritis as defined by physician per participants hospital records prior to the enrolment visit or at diagnosis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- More than or equal to 18 years of age
- Clinician diagnosed LN participants.
- At least one visit to the investigational center during 12 months prior to the baseline visit, recorded in medical documentation.
- Literacy in English or Arabic allowing to fully comprehend the written informed consent and study-specific patient reported questionnaires.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete medical records to be able to assess the disease severity or absence of any of the following renal laboratory results from the medical record within the last twelve months: a. Urinary protein to creatinine ratio (UPCR) or 24-hour proteinuria or urine sediment (activity). b. Serum creatinine or estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR); or measured glomerular filtration rate (GFR), if eGFR is not available.
- Current or medical history of: a. Congenital or acquired immunodeficiency. b. Malignancy in active treatment phase. c. Acute viral infection, such as human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, requiring hospitalization.

overall_contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

overall_contact_backup.last_name: EU GSK Clinical Trials Call Center
